alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:00AM EST until December 19 at 6:06AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... West Deerfield River AT West Deerfield affecting Franklin County. Deerfield At Charlemont affecting Berkshire and Franklin Counties. For the Deerfield River...including Charlemont, West Deerfield... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Deerfield River at West Deerfield. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Portions of Stillwater Rd near I-91, Pogues Hole Rd, Round Pond Rd and Broughams Pond Rd are inundated. Floodwaters encroach on Little Meadow Rd. Also lowest lying recreational fields and some adjacent parking lots close to the Deerfield River are inundated. Flooding occurs along farmland and some farm houses close to the Deerfield River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EST Monday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 10.7 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.6 feet on 09/12/1960. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM EST.
